1.text: Remember, O Jehovah, what is come upon us; consider, and see our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.

3.text: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.

4.text: Our water have we to drink for money, our wood cometh unto us for a price.

5.text: Our pursuers are on our necks: we are weary, we have no rest.

6.text: We have given the hand to Egypt, [and] to Asshur, to be satisfied with bread.

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, [and] they are not; and we bear their iniquities.

8.text: Bondmen rule over us: there is no deliverer out of their hand.

9.text: We have to get our bread at the risk of our lives, because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin gloweth like an oven, because of the burning heat of the famine.

11.text: They have ravished the women in Zion, the maids in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes were hanged up by their hand; the faces of elders were not honoured.

13.text: The young men have borne the mill, and the youths have stumbled under the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their music.

15.text: The joy of our heart hath ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, for we have sinned!

17.text: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes have grown dim,

18.text: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate: foxes walk over it.

19.text: Thou, Jehovah, dwellest for ever; thy throne is from generation to generation.

20.text: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, dost thou forsake us so long time?

21.text: Turn thou us unto thee, Jehovah, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.

22.text: Or is it that thou hast utterly rejected us? Wouldest thou be exceeding wroth against us?
